title: HMR incorrectly rejects updates of once disposed self accepted modules
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

When a self accepted module is 

1. disposed during a hot update (because the `require` call has been removed from its hot updated parent)

2. then required again

... then the hot update is rejected although it should have been accepted.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

See reproduction example: https://github.com/rixo/webpack-bug-hmr (steps are in the README).

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

The hot update of the once disposed module should be accepted, and the module should be updated by HMR, without reloading the page.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  4.32.2
Node.js version: 8.10.0
Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04
Additional tools: webpack-dev-server

**Debugging**

The problem is that when a module is disposed in HMR, it is immediately required again [here](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/HotModuleReplacement.runtime.js#L600), because it has been added to `outdatedSelfAcceptedModules` array [here](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/HotModuleReplacement.runtime.js#L472), because it has been added to `outdatedModules` [just above](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/HotModuleReplacement.runtime.js#L458).

No code for the disposed module is actually fetched or executed, so the module doesn't have a chance to `module.hot.accept()` itself again.

And because of the require call, the module is added again in `installedModules`. So, when the once disposed module is required again, the module is considered [already present and unaccepted](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/HotModuleReplacement.runtime.js#L303). And so the hot update is rejected.

I've tried a patch that prevents a module from being required again just after being disposed, and it does fixes the issue for me. All tests still passing. Here's my change: https://github.com/rixo/webpack/commit/f53c1958206f5b8ed77668230c282cb45b3bcf99
